text: The cardinal tetra (Paracheirodon axelrodi) is a freshwater fish. ==In the aquarium== Cardinal tetras grow to about . They are shoaling fish and like to be kept with other cardinal tetras and they can be kept with other non- aggressive fish. In good conditions the cardinal tetra can live for about five years. The cardinal tetra is a very popular fish but is not as popular as the neon tetra because it is more difficult to breed. They like to live in a temperature of around 23–27°C. ==Diet== The cardinal tetra eats live food such as bloodworms or brine shrimp. ==References== *http://www.liveaquaria.com/product/prod_display.cfm?c=830+890+895&pcatid;=895 *http://www.practicalfishkeeping.co.uk/content.php?sid=3139 *http://www.aquaticcommunity.com/tetrafish/cardinaltetra2.php Category:Characiformes Category:Freshwater fish Category:Aquarium fish
title: Cardinal tetra
